newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps - LS fuel jumps $3 but CFDs dip 10.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps - LS fuel jumps $3 but CFDs dip 10.

text.p: European oil swaps were firmer on oil products on Thursday but Brent crude CFDs fell again.
Heavy fuel rose sharply with the spread between high and low sulphur swaps widening until the year ened.
"The U.S. drove the one percent higher. There was very little demand in Europe," said a trader.
Low sulphur climbed some $3 a tonne to $96 for June by late afternoon after trade at $16.55 a barrel ($104 a tonne) in the U.S.
Further forward the contango between the third and fourth quarters firmed to $6 a tonne at $87.50 and $93.50 respectively.
Low sulphur soared to $10 above barges on the front end due to the U.S. demand.
Gasoline rose 50 cents to $204.50 for June but July remained some $4.50 below June with August a further $3.50 lower.
Naphtha rose $2 a tonne to $188.50 for June and July with the third and fourth quarter cracks holding steady around $1.95 a barrel.
Brent CFDs slumped 10 cents to 27 cents under July for next week and 23 cents under, 19 cents and 20 cents under for the three subsequent weeks.
Jet premiums were little changed although June edged up 50 cents to near $20 above the IPE.
Gas oil crack spreads held at $4.30 a barrel (3Q97), $4.85 (4Q97) and $4.75 (1Q98). -- Sam Arnold-Forster, London Newsroom +44 171 542 4984
